comment: Cayley's Theorem (existence version): every group ` G ` is isomorphic to a subgroup of the symmetric group on the underlying set of ` G ` . (For any group ` G ` there exists an isomorphism ` f ` between ` G ` and a subgroup ` h ` of the symmetric group on the underlying set of ` G ` .) See also Theorem 3.15 in [Rotman] p. 42.
